intro: Stigmaphyllon bogotense, commonly known as the Bogotá stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
